column4: So I downloaded and installed the linux drivers for the ATI card in my laptop. Once I restarted and rebooted, it's having problems, and when I try to start in low-res mode, it never actually gets to the desktop. Is there anyone that can tell me how I reverse the process?
How do I get to the command line before unbuntu GUI boots up?
try and boot into rescue mode
vi or nano, not sure what you are familiar with
you dont have that when you boot up
are you familiar with vi or nano?
try reboot, if that doesn't work, you should be able to remove /etc/X11/xorg.conf
back that file up first though
cd /etc/X11 ; cp xorg.conf xorg.conf.orig ; rm xorg.conf; reboot
yw, hopefully you get a desktop ;)
I do not. But I do have different errors at least - (EE) Unable to locate/open config file  -- (EE) open /dev/fb0: no such file or directory
